summary: Comprehensive testing of DTC Delete Tool - Backend APIs fully functional, Frontend workflow working correctly. PayPal Sandbox integration shows buttons properly. The complete flow (upload -> select DTCs -> payment -> process -> download) works end-to-end via API testing.

minor.issue: Health check endpoint does not exist (returns 404)

passed_tests: File Upload (/api/dtc-engine/upload) - Successfully uploads and analyzes ECU files
Order Creation (/api/dtc-engine/order) - Creates orders with customer info and payment details
DTC Processing (/api/dtc-engine/process) - Processes file and returns download_id
File Download (/api/dtc-engine/download/{id}) - Downloads processed binary file
Process Without Order - Works without order_id
DTC Search by Code - Returns matching results
DTC Search by Description - Returns matching results
Frontend Step 1 (Upload) - Drag & drop area visible, pricing displayed
Frontend Step 2 (Select DTCs) - File info shown, DTC categories available, manual input works
Frontend Step 3 (Payment) - Order summary correct, PayPal buttons visible (Pay with PayPal, Pay Later, Debit/Credit Card)
action_items: IMPORTANT: PayPal Sandbox payment cannot be fully tested via automation (requires real PayPal login). Manual testing with sandbox credentials is recommended.
Email sending uses production domain (ecuflashservice.com) in download URL - this is correct for production but verify email delivery works
critical_code_review_comments: Download URL in email is hardcoded to ecuflashservice.com (line 3506 in server.py) - correct for production
Email service properly configured with Hostinger SMTP
DTC processing stores file content in base64 in MongoDB for persistence across deployments - good practice
seed_data_creation: Created test ECU file at /tmp/test_ecu.bin for testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: DTC Delete Tool backend APIs are fully functional. Frontend shows PayPal buttons correctly. To fully test payment flow, manual testing with PayPal Sandbox account is required. The download functionality works - tested via API. Email sending is configured but actual delivery should be verified manually.
